record.description: Six of some 500 young high school students who gathered for tests at the University of Chicago, march through the arch toward the examination room, hopeful of winning scholarships. Left to right--Nancy Kerr, 9020 Hamilton Avenue; Dolores Jean Lowe, 259 W. 22d St., a Chinese-American student at Harrison Tech; Daphne Woolf, 340 Oakdale Avenue, from Middlesex, England; Boria Zlatich, 840 E. 52nd St., 13, from University High; Virginia Darrow, 4574 Oakenwald Avenue, also 13; and Kay Woodruff, 9303 S. Damen Avenue. Highest passers in aptitude tests will win university scholarships and, according to the new Chicago plan, will be graduated at 18.
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
